results.definition: a person who is in a position to give you special assistance
examples: he used his business contacts to get an introduction to the governor

results.definition: the physical coming together of two or more things
examples: contact with the pier scraped paint from the hull

results.definition: a thin curved glass or plastic lens designed to fit over the cornea in order to correct vision or to deliver medication
be in or establish communication with
examples: He never contacted his children after he emigrated to Australia
the pilot made contact with the base

results.definition: be in direct physical contact with; make contact
examples: The wire must not contact the metal cover
The surfaces contact at this point

results.definition: a channel for communication between groups

examples: her fingers came in contact with the light switch

results.definition: (electronics) a junction where things (as two electrical conductors) touch or are in physical contact
examples: they forget to solder the contacts
they claimed that they had been in contact with extraterrestrial beings

results.definition: the state or condition of touching or of being in immediate proximity
examples: litmus paper turns red on contact with an acid
